snippet: Dozens of faculty members asked the school to withdraw its new sexual misconduct policy, saying it violated basic principles of fairness and would do more harm than good.
abstract: Dozens of Harvard Law School faculty members ask the university to withdraw its new sexual misconduct policy, saying process is overwhelmingly stacked against the accused, violating basic principles of fairness; Harvard College and Harvard Law School are among dozens of institutions being investigated by federal Education Dept over how sexual assault and sexual harassment complaints are handled.

byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and TAMAR LEWIN
byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Cambridge, and Tamar Lewin from New York.

lead_paragraph: Dozens of faculty members asked the school to withdraw its new sexual misconduct policy, saying it violated basic principles of fairness and would do more harm than good.

headline.main: Some Harvard Professors Oppose Policy on Assaults
headline.print_headline: Some Faculty at Harvard Oppose Policy on Assaults
